definition: to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Three visualisations of nuclear combustion in a supernova.
sentences.chinese: 超新星内核燃烧的三种清晰呈像。
然后，它们像超新星一样爆炸。

sentences.english: It comes from observations of supernovae and other very distant sources.
sentences.chinese: 而是来自遥远的超新星和其他非常远的源。

sentences.english: The brightest supernova in 400 years resembles a cosmic string of pearls.
sentences.chinese: 最亮的超新星在400年内类似于一串宇宙珍珠。

sentences.english: Actinides are synthesized very quickly in such environments as supernova explosions.
sentences.chinese: 锕合成很快，在这种环境下，因为超新星爆炸。

sentences.english: These objects include variable stars as well as supernovae.
sentences.chinese: 这些物体包括象超新星这样的变星。

sentences.english: Where can I watch Supernova movie online free full stream?
sentences.chinese: 我在哪里可以在线看电影免费超新星全流？

sentences.english: Supernovas can briefly shine as brightly as an entire galaxy.
sentences.chinese: 超新星能短暂地发出相当于整个星系亮度的光。

sentences.english: Explanation: What's causing those odd rings in supernova 1987A?
sentences.chinese: 是什么引起了超新星1987A周围的环？

sentences.english: The star then explodes in a so-called Type II supernova.
sentences.chinese: 这颗恒星随后发生爆炸，成为II型超新星。

sentences.english: It didn't explode as a supernova, but just sort of hiccuped a brilliant burst of light.
sentences.chinese: 它并没有爆炸成超新星，只是一次能量的突然释放。

sentences.english: Three great eyes on kepler's supernova remnant .
sentences.chinese: 开普勒超新星遗迹中的大三眼。

sentences.english: Riess led the analysis of the HZT data.
sentences.chinese: 里斯领导了高红移超新星搜索团组的数据分析。

sentences.english: Elements heavier than iron are formed in the stellar explosion of a supernova.
sentences.chinese: 比铁更重的元素会在超新星爆发过程中形成。

sentences.english: The teams used a particular kind of supernova, called type Ia supernova.
sentences.chinese: 研究步队用一种Ia型超新星做研究。

pinyin: tian1 ti3 wu4 li3 xue2 jia1

definition: neutrino (particle physics)/also written 微中子[wei1 zhong1 zi3]
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
Ceres, dwarf planet in the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter, discovered in 1801 by G. Piazzi
